group_1.textRight: …Hey, why are you so insistent that we sneak@around?

group_1.textLeft: You're not from this school, Hanna.@It'd be a disaster if you were found out.

group_1.textRight: Eh, I've got a school uniform on.@I can handle it.

group_1.textLeft: What? Even though it belongs to a completely@different school?

group_1.textRight: I can just say I'm from another school,@tryin' to find an acquaintance of mine…

group_1.textLeft: Even though you're going to vandalize@the school?

group_1.textRight: …I'm tryin' to find an acquaintance of mine and@makin' some graffiti while I'm at it…?

group_1.textLeft: You realize that doesn't make any sense, right?

group_1.textRight: GAAAH! Look, the whole point of this is for us@to go crazy!

group_1.textLeft: And if it comes down to it, we can just use@suggestions to bail us out.

group_1.textRight: Anyway, you ready to let the games begin?

group_1.narration: It was easy work.
Whatever I said, like,@"School is prison!", for example,@Hanna would write it down exactly.
Why do I have to work so hard to fit in?!@Why are you all holding me back?!@Why do I have to bury who I really am?!
Whatever I said, Hanna would write it.
I got really into it.
That's why I said all the things I did.
For all the lip service, school is a hellish place@for people who don't have a normal life,
because all they can do is watch@from afar as others live happily,
They get the privilege of having@classmates be their friends,
and fun things to do after school.
The rest of us can only gaze up longingly@at the things that will forever remain@just out of our reach.
But doesn't everyone else take@all those things for granted?
Isn't that considered a part of a normal school life?@And yet, given the way I was, I was utterly@incapable of having that sort of life.
I told myself that if those things were normal,@then I should be able to have them, too…@I was so full of envy, so I pretended@to be someone I really wasn't…
As a result, I was able to have the@appearance of a normal school life…
I kept up the pretense, until I@started losing track of who I was.@In the end, I became nobody.
I became an invisible existence.
Yes, from that moment on, I'd become a ghost.
If you're reading this, I exist!
The ghost has come back!
I'm back to ruin everything!!
We laughed our heads off, but I was able@to get it all out of my system.
We found some desks and chairs, too,@and lined them up in the hallways@and stairs to block everything off.
We didn't even stop at that.
We made the whole thing into a labyrinth.
There's a right way to go, and if you follow it,@you can get from the bottom to the top floor.
I wanted to screen something SUPER@messed up from the AV room@to make everyone grimace,
but I couldn't find anything like that.
Still, Hanna drew some things@on the screen instead!
…Well, she's not the best artist,@so I'm not really sure what it@was supposed to be, but still.
Upon entering the last classroom,@I finally heard some commotion downstairs…
It was too late for them to freak out about it.
As I looked around, I realized@this was my old classroom.
There were so many things I wanted@to vent about in this very room…
But we had run out of paint.
I was a little disappointed…@But all the fun I was having@more than made up for it.
I sat in a seat that was no longer mine.
For the first time ever, I felt so fulfilled there.
Then Hanna grabbed some chalk@to write on the blackboard.
When I saw what she had written,@I couldn't help but laugh.
Yeah, it said everything I had needed to say.
I…and maybe Hanna, too...@We just wanted to prove that we were here.@That we existed.
…The commotion was getting closer.
I wondered if the teachers were also@struggling their way through that labyrinth.@It was kind of funny to imagine.
Then finally, we jumped out the window.
It was a freedom I had never experienced before.

group_1.textLeft: We finally made it…@What about the other classrooms?

group_1.textRight: The way things are going, we won't be able@to hold classes for a while…

group_1.narration: ―Hanna―@Ahahahahaha!@Are they comin' after us?
―Mikoto―@They're not!
―Hanna―@Ahaha! Even if they tried,@they'd never be able to keep up!
―Mikoto―@You think they'll call the police?
―Hanna―@Of course they will!
―Hanna―@I left our signatures at the scene of the crime,@so they just might be able to identify me!
―Mikoto―@*Giggle* Uh oh!
―Hanna―@Ahahaha, this isn't the time to laugh!
―Mikoto―@But you're laughing, too, Hanna!
―Hanna―@'Cause it's fuuun! Ahaha!
―Mikoto―@We caused a lot of trouble, right?@We might even be in the news…!
―Hanna―@Then everyone will remember us!
―Hanna―@Still, though, you know how scummy people are…@They might try and do a cover-up.
―Mikoto―@What? That's so lame.
―Hanna―@It'll be fine, trust me!@Next time, we're gonna hit the whole city!
―Mikoto―@You mean that thing you were making@preparations for back then?
―Hanna―@Yup! If the entire city gets affected,@they'll have no way of covering it up!
―Mikoto―@Great, we still have more to do!@I thought this was the end!
―Hanna―@Ahaha! We've only just begun!
But deep down, we knew the end was near.
We caused so much chaos@that the police were on alert,
and while using suggestions@to gather information,
we learned there were Magical Girls@investigating us, too.
The road we were on only led to a dead end…
We understood that,@but we couldn't help but keep going.
We had this strange and incredible sense@of omnipotent power.
Yes! With Hanna, anything was possible.@We were invincible.
It felt like…we could prove that we were here,@even to that beautiful sunset.
For one little moment,@I held that innocent belief.
